name: sodium benzoate
consensus: Generally recognized as safe at regulated levels
concerns: May cause sensitivity reactions in some individuals
Potential concern when combined with vitamin C under certain conditions
when_it_matters: May matter for people with known preservative sensitivities
when_it_does_not: For most people consuming packaged foods occasionally, evidence suggests low risk

name: potassium sorbate
consensus: Widely used and considered safe within permitted limits
concerns: Rare reports of mild skin or digestive irritation
when_it_matters: May matter for individuals with very sensitive skin or digestion
when_it_does_not: For the general population, it is not considered a significant concern

name: aspartame
consensus: Approved for use by major regulatory authorities
concerns: Not suitable for individuals with phenylketonuria (PKU)
Ongoing public debate despite regulatory approval
when_it_matters: Matters for people with PKU or those consuming large amounts regularly
when_it_does_not: For most people, occasional consumption is considered safe by regulators

name: sucralose
concerns: Some evidence suggests possible effects on gut microbiota
when_it_matters: May matter for people sensitive to artificial sweeteners
when_it_does_not: For occasional use, current evidence does not indicate major risk

name: tartrazine
consensus: Permitted for use with restrictions in many countries
concerns: Possible behavioral sensitivity in a subset of children
when_it_matters: May matter for children with known sensitivity to food dyes
when_it_does_not: For most adults, evidence does not suggest meaningful risk

name: sunset yellow
concerns: Potential sensitivity reactions in some individuals
when_it_matters: May matter for individuals sensitive to food colors
when_it_does_not: For most people, consumption within limits is considered low risk

name: monosodium glutamate
consensus: Considered safe for the general population
concerns: Some people report headache or discomfort, evidence is mixed
when_it_matters: May matter for people who report sensitivity symptoms
when_it_does_not: For most people, MSG does not cause adverse effects

name: disodium inosinate
concerns: May contribute to higher sodium intake when combined with other additives
when_it_matters: May matter for individuals monitoring sodium intake
when_it_does_not: At typical levels, it is not considered a major concern

name: palm oil
when_it_matters: May matter for people managing cholesterol or heart health
when_it_does_not: In small amounts, it is comparable to other saturated fats

name: hydrogenated vegetable oil
consensus: Source of trans fats, which are widely discouraged
when_it_matters: Matters for anyone concerned about heart health
when_it_does_not: Rare in products reformulated to remove trans fats

name: citric acid
consensus: Widely used and generally considered safe
concerns: May cause irritation in very sensitive individuals
when_it_matters: May matter for people with sensitive teeth or stomach
when_it_does_not: For most people, it is not a health concern

name: phosphoric acid
consensus: Approved for use in food and beverages
concerns: Excessive intake may affect bone health
when_it_matters: May matter for people consuming large amounts of soft drinks
when_it_does_not: Occasional intake is not considered harmful

name: lecithin
concerns: May be derived from soy, which can matter for allergies
when_it_matters: Matters for individuals with soy allergy
when_it_does_not: For most people, lecithin is not a concern

name: xanthan gum
concerns: May cause digestive discomfort in some people at high amounts
when_it_matters: May matter for people with sensitive digestion
when_it_does_not: At typical levels, it is well tolerated

name: sodium nitrite
consensus: Permitted with strict limits in processed meats
concerns: Potential formation of harmful compounds at high intake
when_it_matters: May matter for frequent consumers of processed meats
when_it_does_not: Occasional consumption within limits is generally considered safe
